TopicTitle: The Most Important Mod Request I Have Ever Made.

Articles.Content:
Kerbals should, naa... MUST make a "rubber ducky"/"dog squeak toy" sound when they hit the ground. Something similar to a sharp squeeze.

[Danny2462 example](https://youtu.be/aM00FwK4La0?t=1m50s)

I know its just a little thing, but it fits the kerbal genre perfectly (in my humble, but correct opinion). ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Its the little things that can add a lot to a game.

Here are some examples:

[http://www.audioblocks.com/search/?srch-term=dog+toy&srch-type=all](http://www.audioblocks.com/search/?srch-term=dog+toy&srch-type=all)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vnvEeVKJFSM?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

[http://www.pond5.com/sound-effect/46022073/dog-squeeze-toy-1.html](http://www.pond5.com/sound-effect/46022073/dog-squeeze-toy-1.html)

One bounce sound effect may not be enough. We may need a whole slew of them. Bouncing high, bouncing low, bouncing on the mun, bouncing fast, bouncing slow. I can't possibly list them all here. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If you agree (and how couldn't you?), please leave a link to the sound effect that most fits a kerbal bouncing.

EDIT: GreeningGalaxy suggested that 'Bonus points if kerbal death leaves a lingering "SQUEEeeee.e..e." deflating sound in the air behind it.' **ROFL**

A couple ideas:

[[[http://www.soundsnap.com/tags/deflate\]\]](http://www.soundsnap.com/tags/deflate%5D%5D)

[[[http://www.freesfx.co.uk/soundeffects/balloon/\]\]](http://www.freesfx.co.uk/soundeffects/balloon/%5D%5D)

Maybe a balloon popping sound might also be appropriate.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-12T17:14:24Z" title="06/12/2015 05:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 12, 2015</time> by Probus**
  
Additional sound FX

[Collision FX](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101496) adds an "Oof" sound when Kerbals hit the ground... Someone requested the same "squeak" sound that you're asking, and the community delivered ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Relevant posts:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101496-1-0-x-Collision-FX-v3-2-%282015-05-14%29-Now-with-EVA-kerbal-sound-effects%21?p=1906254&viewfull=1#post1906254](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101496-1-0-x-Collision-FX-v3-2-%282015-05-14%29-Now-with-EVA-kerbal-sound-effects%21?p=1906254&viewfull=1#post1906254)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101496-1-0-x-Collision-FX-v3-2-%282015-05-14%29-Now-with-EVA-kerbal-sound-effects%21?p=1915448&viewfull=1#post1915448](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101496-1-0-x-Collision-FX-v3-2-%282015-05-14%29-Now-with-EVA-kerbal-sound-effects%21?p=1915448&viewfull=1#post1915448)
Oh my god that is the greatest idea ever made...how did I not think of it before now??
Their steps also should add a quiet rubber ducky sound too
And replace the Kerbal texture with a rubber duckey one.... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
And their helmets should be bubbles
This is amazing! I installed Collision FX just for the squeakies.
